content.description: The crux is probably the sharper holds towards the end. They hurt if you get carried away. Besides that just stay close to the ground, and at the end move up a little and keep going right..
content.protection: a boulder pad and a friend help.
content.location: Start sitting on (or next to the 15 inch high boulder at the left end of the Pocket Boulder. Pull off 2 same-facing sidepulls to get started. Traverse right all the way around the corner until you are sitting or standing on the rock that sustains the water meter stick.

content.description: Route goes up the center of Pocket Boulder.
content.protection: 1 pad should do you good. There are anchors at the top if you feel the desire to headpoint the thing.
content.location: On the face of the boulder between the slab side and the overhanging face.

content.description: Sit start on left hand small sidepull and right hand sloper about 8-10 feet left of Crouching Tiger. Bump up to crimps then big jugs at the ledge. Traverse to the right, link up with Crouching Tiger and share finish with Hidden Dragon
content.protection: Several pads to cover length of traverse
content.location: 8-10 feet left of Crouching tiger on the backside of PA's Mother.

content.description:
Stand start on embedded rock on right side of landing area.

Start on high right & even higher left hand crimps. Use poor feet to jump to a slopey jutting jug out far left.
content.protection: At least a couple well-placed boulder pads.  Place them further left of the starting stance and back a couple feet since that's where you'll land if you fall on the jump to the top.
content.location: Just uphill from the Pocket Boulder, the Orange Crush "boulder" is located on the back side of P.A.'s Mother. On main trail, 4 minutes' walk past Kitchen/gate, arrive at 9 foot boulders on the left side of the trail. Cross the stream bed to a campsite. From the campfire ring, head west (down canyon) up a small trail marked with rocks. 2 minutes from main trail.

content.description: Start w/ left hand on sloper and right hand in a gaston sidepull. Bump right hand to a good two finger pocket and left hand to a three or four finger pocket. Big move with the right hand to the sloper and top out.
content.location: Follows same line of Blast Off

content.description: Sit start with left hand in the three finger pocket (used as right hand start on "Blast Off") and the left hand on a quarter pad crimp under the cave. Heel hook helps on start. Move right hand to bad sidepull and then get ready for the freak show - make a huge move to a left hand sidepull (used as left hand start on "Blast Off"). Rest of the problem should be straight forward. If you are a soild V6/7 climber, you should have no problem sending this in a session or two.
content.protection: 2 pads will be best. Spotter highly recommended.
content.location:
Sit start with left hand in the three finger pocket (used as right hand start on "Blast Off") and the left hand on a quarter pad crimp under the cave. Heel hook helps on start.

Located on pocket boulder - see area page for directions on how to get there

content.description:
Stand start on left side of rock face.

Start with left hand big side pull; right hand crimp.  Right hand up to good incut crimp.
content.location: Just uphill from the Pocket Boulder, the Orange Crush "boulder" is located on the back side of P.A.'s Mother. 4 minutes' walk on the main train above the Kitchen/gate, arrive at the 9 foot boulders on the left side of the trail. Then, cross streambed to a campsite. From campfire ring, head west (down canyon) up a small trail marked with rocks. 2 minutes from main trail.

content.description: Sit start, and go straight up. If you use the jugs it makes it more V5 but if you skip them it feels more V6 or V6+ to me.
content.protection: Boulder Pad to protect from the riverbed rocks.
content.location: On the skightly overhanging face start on obvious low pocket(Right) and sidepull(Left).
